p: Using the optimal conditions of S. chinensis dry powder (10.0 g) in distilled water at a 1:30 ( w/ v) ratio, the extractions were done using different amounts of ultrasound and microwave power. Single factor experiments were performed for ultrasound and microwave power ( Figure 3b,c). At ultrasound powers of less than 550 W, the polysaccharide yield increased with increasing ultrasound power. However, the polysaccharide yields at ultrasound powers of 550 W and 700 W were similar. Therefore, an ultrasound power of 550 W was selected for subsequent experiments. In the microwave extraction process, the polysaccharide yields gradually increased with increasing microwave power, with 250 W selected as optimal microwave power for subsequent experiments.
